class: Polish Adverbs - Adjective to Adverb Transformations

rows.english: Today is an ugly day. - It is ugly/nasty.
Yesterday was a cold evening. - It was cold.

rows.polish: W tym roku lato będzie bardzo gorące.
rows.english: This year summer will be very hot. - It will be hot.
Tomorrow the weather will be nice. - It will be nice.
His presentation was very interesting. - He spoke interestingly.
Your Polish is very good. - You speak Polish well.
This car is very fast. - This car drives very fast.

rows.polish: Nasze mieszkanie jest małe. Mamy za mało miejsca na książki.
rows.english: Our apartment is small. We have too little space for books.

rows.polish: Japonki wyglądają młodo, choć nie zawsze są młode.
rows.english: Japanese women look young (adv.), though they aren't always young (adj.).

rows.polish: Adam dużo maluje. Ten duży obraz w salonie to prezent od niego.
rows.english: Adam paints a lot. That big painting in the living room is a gift from him.

rows.polish: Nie gotuję dobrze, ale moja rodzina mówi, że robię bardzo dobre pierogi.
rows.english: I don't cook well, but my family says I make very good pierogi.

rows.polish: Ta sukienka jest piękna! Wyglądasz w niej naprawdę pięknie!
rows.english: This dress is beautiful (adj.)! You look really beautifully (adv.) in it!

rows.polish: Źle zrobiłeś ten projekt. Podałeś złe dane.
rows.english: You did this project badly (adv.). You provided bad (adj.) data.

rows.polish: Bardzo lubię "Gazetę Codzienną". Czytam ją codziennie.
rows.english: I really like the "Daily (Newspaper)". I read it daily (adv.).
